issue.title: refactor: Rename `Document`'s `text` field to `content`
issue.body:
### Proposed Changes:

This PR renames all occurences of `Document`'s `text` field to `content` to enhance backward compatbility.

### How did you test it?

Updated tests and ran all unit tests locally.

### Notes for the reviewer

This depends on #6180.

I might have missed renaming in some docstrings and comments, but there are way toooooo many occurences of text to handle. 🫠

### Checklist

- I have read the [contributors guidelines](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) and the [code of conduct](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/code_of_conduct.txt)
- I have updated the related issue with new insights and changes

- I've used one of the [conventional commit types](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) for my PR title: `fix:`, `feat:`, `build:`, `chore:`, `ci:`, `docs:`, `style:`, `refactor:`, `perf:`, `test:`.

- I ran [pre-commit hooks](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#installation) and fixed any issue

comment.body:
@silvanocerza wait aren't linting errors in:
haystack/preview/components/readers/extractive.py:199: error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has type "List[List[Any]]", variable has type "Tensor")  [assignment]
haystack/preview/components/readers/extractive.py:205: error: Incompatible return value type (got "Tuple[Any, Tensor, Tensor]", expected "Tuple[List[List[int]], List[List[int]], Tensor]")  [return-value]

Which would be a preview, no?

issue.title: Refactor `Answer` to be backward compatible
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Preview `Answer` dataclass differs from the legacy 1.x `Answer` in some fields. This breaks backward compatibility.

We should adapt it much like we've done with `Document` in #6180.
So we need to rename `metadata` to `meta` and make it possible to access `data` using the `answer` field. 
Adding an `answer` property should suffice as we did for `content_type`. We should also handle creation of an `Answer` using `answer` as init parameter, again we can handle this in a similar way as we did for `Document` using a metaclass.

comment.body:
Linting workflow is failing, but only the 1.x version. That workflow is not even supposed to be running for PRs editing only the `preview` package as this one.

It's ok to ignore it and merge this PR in any case as [`Linting (preview)` workflow](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/actions/runs/6665335282?pr=6181) is green. ✅

commits.message: Add first unit tests, small fixes

comment.body: `GRADIENT_WORKSPACE_ID` also needs to be set or otherwise we need to skip the test.

pull_request.title: feat: introduce integration with Gradient AI
pull_request.body:
### Related Issues

Doesn't have have a related issue.

### Proposed Changes:

[Gradient AI](https://gradient.ai/) is a self-managed cloud service for Large Language Models, offering fine-tuning and inference of open-source models and embeddings generation. This PR integrates haystack with Gradient for LLMs and embeddings by adding relevant generators and embedders.

### How did you test it?

* unit testing,
* e2e test based on the RAG test.

### Notes for the reviewer

* please note that we added a new optional dependency set that needs to be installed with `pip install -e .[gradient]`,
* integration requires a generated access token, and tests assume set up environment variables. Please refer to our docs for [SDK](https://docs.gradient.ai/docs/sdk-quickstart) or for [CLI](https://docs.gradient.ai/docs/cli-quickstart). The CLI can set up environment variables with `$(gradient env)` command once it's configured.

### Checklist

[x] I have read the [contributors guidelines](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) and the [code of conduct](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/code_of_conduct.txt)
[x] ~I have updated the related issue with new insights and changes~ N/A
[x] I added unit tests and updated the docstrings
[x] I've used one of the [conventional commit types](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) for my PR title: `fix:`, `feat:`, `build:`, `chore:`, `ci:`, `docs:`, `style:`, `refactor:`, `perf:`, `test:`. NOTE: to be squashed.
[x] I documented my code
[x] I ran [pre-commit hooks](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#installation) and fixed any issue

+import numpy as np
+
+from haystack.preview import Document
+
+
+access_token = "access_token"
+workspace_id = "workspace_id"
+model = "bge-large"
+
+
+def has_gradient():
+    try:
+        import gradientai
+
+        return True
+    except ModuleNotFoundError:
+        return False
+
+
+@pytest.mark.skipif(not has_gradient(), reason="Gradient is not installed")
+class TestGradientDocumentEmbedder:
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_init_from_env(self, monkeypatch):
+        monkeypatch.setenv("GRADIENT_ACCESS_TOKEN", access_token)
+        monkeypatch.setenv("GRADIENT_WORKSPACE_ID", workspace_id)
+
+        embedder = GradientDocumentEmbedder()
+        assert embedder is not None
+        assert embedder._gradient.workspace_id == workspace_id
+        assert embedder._gradient._api_client.configuration.access_token == access_token
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_init_without_access_token(self, monkeypatch):
+        monkeypatch.delenv("GRADIENT_ACCESS_TOKEN", raising=True)
+
+        with pytest.raises(ValueError):
+            GradientDocumentEmbedder(workspace_id=workspace_id)
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_init_without_workspace(self, monkeypatch):
+        monkeypatch.delenv("GRADIENT_WORKSPACE_ID", raising=True)
+
+        with pytest.raises(ValueError):
+            GradientDocumentEmbedder(access_token=access_token)
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_init_from_params(self):
+        embedder = GradientDocumentEmbedder(access_token=access_token, workspace_id=workspace_id)
+        assert embedder is not None
+        assert embedder._gradient.workspace_id == workspace_id
+        assert embedder._gradient._api_client.configuration.access_token == access_token
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_init_from_params_precedence(self, monkeypatch):
+        monkeypatch.setenv("GRADIENT_ACCESS_TOKEN", "env_access_token")
+        monkeypatch.setenv("GRADIENT_WORKSPACE_ID", "env_workspace_id")
+
+        embedder = GradientDocumentEmbedder(access_token=access_token, workspace_id=workspace_id)
+        assert embedder is not None
+        assert embedder._gradient.workspace_id == workspace_id
+        assert embedder._gradient._api_client.configuration.access_token == access_token
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_to_dict(self):
+        component = GradientDocumentEmbedder(access_token=access_token, workspace_id=workspace_id)
+        data = component.to_dict()
+        assert data == {
+            "type": "GradientDocumentEmbedder",
+            "init_parameters": {"workspace_id": workspace_id, "model_name": "bge-large"},
+        }
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_warmup(self):
+        embedder = GradientDocumentEmbedder(access_token=access_token, workspace_id=workspace_id)
+        embedder._gradient.get_embeddings_model = MagicMock()
+        embedder.warm_up()
+        embedder._gradient.get_embeddings_model.assert_called_once_with(slug="bge-large")
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_warmup_doesnt_reload(self):
+        embedder = GradientDocumentEmbedder(access_token=access_token, workspace_id=workspace_id)
+        embedder._gradient.get_embeddings_model = MagicMock(default_return_value="fake model")
+        embedder.warm_up()
+        embedder.warm_up()
+        embedder._gradient.get_embeddings_model.assert_called_once_with(slug="bge-large")
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_run_fail_if_not_warmed_up(self):
+        embedder = GradientDocumentEmbedder(access_token=access_token, workspace_id=workspace_id)
+
+        with pytest.raises(RuntimeError, match="warm_up()"):
+            embedder.run(documents=[Document(text=f"document number {i}") for i in range(5)])
+
+    @pytest.mark.unit
+    def test_run(self):
comment.body: Please add another test case with an empty list as input: `embedder.run(documents=[])`. The returned `result["documents"]` should be an empty list then too.

pull_request.title: feat: introduce integration with Gradient AI
pull_request.body:
### Related Issues

Doesn't have have a related issue.

### Proposed Changes:

[Gradient AI](https://gradient.ai/) is a self-managed cloud service for Large Language Models, offering fine-tuning and inference of open-source models and embeddings generation. This PR integrates haystack with Gradient for LLMs and embeddings by adding relevant generators and embedders.

### How did you test it?

* unit testing,
* e2e test based on the RAG test.

### Notes for the reviewer

* please note that we added a new optional dependency set that needs to be installed with `pip install -e .[gradient]`,
* integration requires a generated access token, and tests assume set up environment variables. Please refer to our docs for [SDK](https://docs.gradient.ai/docs/sdk-quickstart) or for [CLI](https://docs.gradient.ai/docs/cli-quickstart). The CLI can set up environment variables with `$(gradient env)` command once it's configured.

### Checklist

[x] I have read the [contributors guidelines](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) and the [code of conduct](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/code_of_conduct.txt)
[x] ~I have updated the related issue with new insights and changes~ N/A
[x] I added unit tests and updated the docstrings
[x] I've used one of the [conventional commit types](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) for my PR title: `fix:`, `feat:`, `build:`, `chore:`, `ci:`, `docs:`, `style:`, `refactor:`, `perf:`, `test:`. NOTE: to be squashed.
[x] I documented my code
[x] I ran [pre-commit hooks](https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#installation) and fixed any issue

repo.name: haystack
repo.description: :mag: LLM orchestration framework to build customizable, production-ready LLM applications. Connect components (models, vector DBs, file converters) to pipelines or agents that can interact with your data. With advanced retrieval methods, it's best suited for building RAG, question answering, semantic search or conversational agent chatbots.

comment.body:
Let's add a usage example here, for example

```python
p = Pipeline()
p.add_component(instance=GradientDocumentEmbedder(), name="document_embedder")
p.add_component(instance=DocumentWriter(document_store=InMemoryDocumentStore()), name="document_writer")
p.connect("document_embedder", "document_writer")
p.run({"document_embedder": {"documents": documents}})
```

please start the example code with \`\`\`python

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,103 @@
+from typing import List, Optional, Dict, Any, overload
+
+import logging
+from haystack.lazy_imports import LazyImport
+
+from haystack.preview import component, default_to_dict
+
+with LazyImport(message="Run 'pip install gradientai'") as gradientai_import:
+    from gradientai import Gradient
+
+logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
+
+
+@component
+class GradientGenerator:
+    @overload
+    def __init__(
+        self,
+        *,
+        access_token: Optional[str] = None,
+        base_model_slug: str,
+        host: Optional[str] = None,
+        max_generated_token_count: Optional[int] = None,
+        temperature: Optional[float] = None,
+        top_k: Optional[int] = None,
+        top_p: Optional[float] = None,
+        workspace_id: Optional[str] = None,
+    ) -> None:
+        ...
+
+    @overload
+    def __init__(
+        self,
+        *,
+        access_token: Optional[str] = None,
+        host: Optional[str] = None,
+        max_generated_token_count: Optional[int] = None,
+        model_adapter_id: str,
+        temperature: Optional[float] = None,
+        top_k: Optional[int] = None,
+        top_p: Optional[float] = None,
+        workspace_id: Optional[str] = None,
+    ) -> None:
+        ...
+
+    def __init__(
+        self,
+        *,
+        access_token: Optional[str] = None,
+        base_model_slug: Optional[str] = None,
+        host: Optional[str] = None,
+        max_generated_token_count: Optional[int] = None,
+        model_adapter_id: Optional[str] = None,
+        temperature: Optional[float] = None,
+        top_k: Optional[int] = None,
+        top_p: Optional[float] = None,
+        workspace_id: Optional[str] = None,
+    ) -> None:
+        self._access_token = access_token
+        self._base_model_slug = base_model_slug
+        self._host = host
+        self._max_generated_token_count = max_generated_token_count
+        self._model_adapter_id = model_adapter_id
+        self._temperature = temperature
+        self._top_k = top_k
+        self._top_p = top_p
+        self._workspace_id = workspace_id
+
+        if (base_model_slug is None and model_adapter_id is None) or (
+            isinstance(base_model_slug, str) and isinstance(model_adapter_id, str)
+        ):
+            raise ValueError("expected be provided exactly one of base_model_slug or model_adapter_id")
+
+        self._gradient = Gradient(access_token=access_token, host=host, workspace_id=workspace_id)
+        if isinstance(base_model_slug, str):
+            self._model = self._gradient.get_base_model(base_model_slug=base_model_slug)
+        if isinstance(model_adapter_id, str):
+            self._model = self._gradient.get_model_adapter(model_adapter_id=model_adapter_id)
+
+    def to_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+        return default_to_dict(
+            self,
+            access_token=self._access_token,
comment.body: We should leave this out and not serialize the access token.

repo.name: haystack
repo.description: :mag: LLM orchestration framework to build customizable, production-ready LLM applications. Connect components (models, vector DBs, file converters) to pipelines or agents that can interact with your data. With advanced retrieval methods, it's best suited for building RAG, question answering, semantic search or conversational agent chatbots.

review.body:
Great to see this PR! Looks quite good to me already. I was able to run the end-to-end test locally. 👍 
I have some smaller change requests in the comments below. Please also generate a release note with reno as described here: https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#release-notes You can put your text under `preview` in that note.

pull_request.title: feat: introduce integration with Gradient AI
pull_request.body:
### Related Issues

Doesn't have have a related issue.

### Proposed Changes:

[Gradient AI](https://gradient.ai/) is a self-managed cloud service for Large Language Models, offering fine-tuning and inference of open-source models and embeddings generation. This PR integrates haystack with Gradient for LLMs and embeddings by adding relevant generators and embedders.

### How did you test it?

* unit testing,
* e2e test based on the RAG test.

### Notes for the reviewer

* please note that we added a new optional dependency set that needs to be installed with `pip install -e .[gradient]`,
* integration requires a generated access token, and tests assume set up environment variables. Please refer to our docs for [SDK](https://docs.gradient.ai/docs/sdk-quickstart) or for [CLI](https://docs.gradient.ai/docs/cli-quickstart). The CLI can set up environment variables with `$(gradient env)` command once it's configured.

issue.title: Support fastembed retrievers and ranker
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
[fastembed](https://github.com/qdrant/fastembed) support light models using ONNX version of the embedder. At the moment is (maybe) the best alternatives to closed embedder for production solutions.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be great if there was support within the EmbeddingRetriever and Ranker.

issue.title: Re-evaluate frozen Documents

labels.name: P1
labels.description: High priority, add to the next sprint

issue.body:
The Document class of Haystack 2.0 is frozen. We need to be confident about this decision before the 2.0 release.

The reasoning behind this choice is that the ID and the eventual embedding represent the content of a document. So IDs, embeddings and content should be difficult to change without changing the other. However it's still easy to make the mistake of updating the embedding without changing the content, and re-creating the class every time just slows us the component.

Let's keep in mind also that un-freezing them is an easier decision than freezing them back.

If we un-freeze Document, then I think we should consider:

1. Tie more strongly the ID to the fields that generated it (so IDs don't go out of sync accidentally). This may mean making ID a property instead of a field?

2. introducing a way to track which model generated a given embedding. Maybe an Embedding class with two fields (`embedding` and `embedder_model`)? Another field in Document (`embedder_model`)?

Original discussion: https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/pull/5822#discussion_r1327344282

Let's keep in mind also that un-freezing them is an easier decision than freezing them back.

If we un-freeze Document, then I think we should consider:

2. introducing a way to track which model generated a given embedding. Maybe an Embedding class with two fields (`embedding` and `embedder_model`)? Another field in Document (`embedder_model`)?

comment.body: We unfroze the document data class. Closing this.

issue.title: Review logging in 2.0: exclude user data from certain logs

labels.name: P3
labels.description: Low priority, leave it in the backlog

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We want to review logging for 2.0 and exclude user data (queries, answers, file content, documents, feedback?, X?) from certain log levels.

We still want this user data to be logged somehow, so consumers of those logs can decide what they log or not.

Usage examples 
1. You want to send logs to a third party SaaS solution (like datadog): it might be required by law to remove all user information.
2. You deploy your own onprem logging solution: you might be interested in collecting and visualizing all user-related data.

comment.body: Since it does not introduce major changes to the API we will remove the milestone for this item.
